translated: (1) Thus have I heard. Once, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in the Jeta Grove near Śrāvastī.
At that time, the World-Honored One told the bhikṣus:
Contemplate form as impermanent.
One who contemplates in this way is said to have right contemplation.
One with right contemplation will give rise to disgust;
One who is disgusted will end delight and craving;
One who ends delight and craving is said to have liberated mind.
Contemplate in the same way that feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are impermanent.
One who contemplates in this way is said to have right contemplation.
One with right contemplation will give rise to disgust;
One who is disgusted will end delight and craving;
One who ends delight and craving is said to have liberated mind.
In this way, bhikṣus!
